alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Rooks (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 05 at 7:17PM CDT until June 06 at 9:41PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Hastings NE has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas... Bow Creek Near Stockton affecting Phillips and Rooks Counties. South Fork Solomon River Near Woodston affecting Osborne and Rooks Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bow Creek Near Stockton. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water overflows both banks of the river and flows into adjacent agricultural lowland. Gravel county roads along and crossing the Bow Creek both upstream and downstream of the Highway 183 gauge site will begin to flood. Several of the roads that will flood include: A Road, B Road, and 17 Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CDT Sunday was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.9 feet on 05/28/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
